snippet.textDisplay: DRAGON QUEST XI it's almost here my fells slimez!
snippet.textOriginal: DRAGON QUEST XI it's almost here my fells slimez!

snippet.textDisplay:
Um império a surgir
Seu povo está a sorrir
Seus campos são tão grande
São tão vastos
São tão largos
Iuminados
Tanto orgulho no ato

Meu orgulho é ter pra mim as tuas amadas bênçãos, tão raras!
O meu sonho é dominar, mais terras férteis ao teu belo povo.
Sempre serei fiel pois foi tu que deu-me os céus.
E eu sonho em te honrar, ó império popular!

Minha sina é te orgulhar ó, grande império, sacra morada.
Meu desejo é conquistar, dar a teu filho, o meu mais belo ouro.
Guerreiro serei se a paz eu for defender.
Lealdade eu vou jurar, ó império popular!

Em ti confio a minha vida sim...
Grande pai de orgulho.
Meu amor por ti, eu juro.

snippet.textDisplay:
Am I the only one noticing an uncanny resemblance to Tchaikovsky's Polonaise Op. 24 (part of his opera "Eugene Onegin")?
On the other hand, none of Sugiyama's work is original.
snippet.textOriginal:
Am I the only one noticing an uncanny resemblance to Tchaikovsky's Polonaise Op. 24 (part of his opera "Eugene Onegin")?
On the other hand, none of Sugiyama's work is original.

snippet.textDisplay: This overture is not in Sonata form. Sonata form requires a modulation in the exposition, a development section in a contrasting key, and a recap without modulation. For an example of something that's actually in sonata form, check out the symphonic suite version of DQ3's Rondo.
snippet.textOriginal: This overture is not in Sonata form. Sonata form requires a modulation in the exposition, a development section in a contrasting key, and a recap without modulation. For an example of something that's actually in sonata form, check out the symphonic suite version of DQ3's Rondo.

snippet.textDisplay: The fanfare is very similar but otherwise no.
snippet.textOriginal: The fanfare is very similar but otherwise no.

snippet.textDisplay:
@LordMyoo The whole Polonaise is a fanfare, and has the same sonata form as this march, with a slow section in the middle.
It's okay if you want to defend your hero. I understand.
snippet.textOriginal:
@LordMyoo The whole Polonaise is a fanfare, and has the same sonata form as this march, with a slow section in the middle.
It's okay if you want to defend your hero. I understand.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm gonna weigh in and say...no? They both start with a fanfare, and that's basically it. They aren't even close when it comes to genre and their composition is entirely different, owing largely to completely different rhythm (the polonaise is of obvious reasons in a swaying dance-like rhythm while Sugiyama's piece is a rather straight grandiose fanfare) and dynamics.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm gonna weigh in and say...no? They both start with a fanfare, and that's basically it. They aren't even close when it comes to genre and their composition is entirely different, owing largely to completely different rhythm (the polonaise is of obvious reasons in a swaying dance-like rhythm while Sugiyama's piece is a rather straight grandiose fanfare) and dynamics.

snippet.textDisplay: Now this series is just as old as you are!
snippet.textOriginal: Now this series is just as old as you are!

snippet.textDisplay:
Today marks the 25th anniversary of this great series. Definitely one of my favorites of all time. So many memories of playing the games, especially the first four on the NES with my brothers. I recently forced myself to stop playing DQ9 since it could eat way too many hours of my time (after you beat the final boss and do the grottos). The next DQ I'll play is probably DQ5 on the Nintendo DS.

This Overture is a classic, it could have easily been a x00 entry. Gotta love Sugiyama.
snippet.textOriginal:
Today marks the 25th anniversary of this great series. Definitely one of my favorites of all time. So many memories of playing the games, especially the first four on the NES with my brothers. I recently forced myself to stop playing DQ9 since it could eat way too many hours of my time (after you beat the final boss and do the grottos). The next DQ I'll play is probably DQ5 on the Nintendo DS.

This Overture is a classic, it could have easily been a x00 entry. Gotta love Sugiyama.
